title: HELP!   Thunderbird 128.2.0 on Win 10 stopped sending Gmail account emails.   Mozilla fixes not working... HELP!
content:
My Thunderbird on an updated Win 10 desktop stopped sending gmail messages. They time and error out.

Was also failing on older Tbird version so updated to current ver 128.2.0 but no improvement.

I have followed Mozilla's several published accept cookie and IMAP sendmail OAuth2 fixes but without any improvement. Still same error message when try to email from one of my IMAP Gmail accounts on Tbird.

TBird 128.2.0 Error Message: "Thunderbird error message: Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.gmail.com timed out. Try again."

I need HELP!

db
creator: dbotas

title: New messages are not displayed
content: I just started seeing this occur today. When I started Thunderbird, my main e-mail has the subject matter, date and time, but doesn't display the message. All my other e-mail identities are unaffected. All e-mails from previous dates are displayed properly. New messages today are displayed correctly. I tried to forward one of the messages to another address, and it came out blank. I tried starting it in Troubleshooting mode, but it made absolutely no difference. How do I view the messages?
creator: lowellmorton

title: Microsoft OAuth Authentication
content: I get an empty oauth window as outlined in Cannot login to outlook account (empty oauth window) - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1443825. I have ensured that all the requirements as per Microsoft OAuth Authentication and Thunderbird in 2024 (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/microsoft-oauth-authentication-and-thunderbird-202) but still get the empty login window (see screenshot). Where do I go from here?

title: Adding Comcast Account to Thunderbird
content: Go through process to add a Comcast/Xfinity email account. Everything looks right; choosing continue takes me to Xfinity logon page. With proper username ( and third party app allowed in Comcast settings). it then shows the "Let's Go" button. Clicking that results in an ACCESS DENIED/permission issue to the server. Using another browser (including FF) lets me log in fine. Spent 2 hours with Xfinity support who claimed to have made some account adjustments that ultimately did nothing. Would like to be able to add Xfinity account to Thunderbird ( I do have latest version). Thoughts and advice appreciated.
creator: Rivergoat

title: conflict between Inbox info and the content
content:
Have just had an issue with an email coming in from a support person at the Uni helpdesk. The inbox (see below left) shows the correct name and email address, but the content is quite different.

When I checked the mail using Outlook, the correct file content was shown (see below right).

I have tried compacting the Inbox folder within TB [128.2.0esr (64-bit)], but no change. I am running Win 11 (64-bit) 23H2 with the latest cumulative update (KB5043076) installed 5 days ago.

Any suggestions gratefully received!

Bill

content: Hello! I'm having a rather strange problem...I often need to quick filter messages to find certain emails, but for the past few weeks, any time I filter for a specific email (e.g. 3355 - a job number) and then click on the email I want to respond to, it disappears from the list of filtered emails. I imagine this must be some setting in Thunderbird that has gotten toggled in the wrong way, but I can't find the problem. Any idea why this might be happening?

creator: j.galis774

title: UI abysmally slow, Activity Monitor useless.
content: I have been using TB (under Ubuntu) for years without problems. I am now on version 115.15.0. Suddenly today the performance of the UI is abysmal. Even selecting a different folder to view in the navigation pane can take over a minute to complete. The activity monitor is no help. It often shows that nothing is happening when I am waiting for the view to change from one folder to another. When it does show something, it is usually indexing an inbox, but I have 5 accounts with inboxes, so this is no help. How can I see which inbox is being indexed? Some posts say that there should be a pause button in the Activity Monitor for the indexing activity, but I don't see any such thing. Some posts recommend changing mailbox format from mbox to mdir, but they don't say how. Searches for "mdir" in Thunderbird's settings and in the support knowledge base support knowledge base came up empty. How can I restore Thunderbird's normal performance?
creator: rsbrux

title: Exchange support in Thunderbird Beta
content:
Hi,

I'd like to try to configure an Exchange (Office 365) account in Thunderbird Beta, and it doesn't work for me. I use the autodiscover and: 1. Thunderbird tells me that it can recover the connection settings, okay 2. It offers me IMAP, POP and Exchange/Office365. If I select the last one, it says that the server doesn't allow open protocols and that I must install/pay the Owl extension. 3. If I select "configure manually" with Exchange protocol, an error appears: "Component returned failure code: 0x80040111 (NS_ERROR_NOT_AVAILABLE) [nsiMsgAccountManager.createIncomingServer]

Thx
creator: Dimass

title: Thunderbird adding double quotes around local part of email address
content:
I have an email contact who uses alias emails to include team members as CC. Such an alias can have the form !wawProdAIProjects@domainsample.com However, I suspect it's the "!" in the local part that causes Thunderbird (or actually SeaMonkey, which I still use, but I have tested it and the behavior is the same in both) to change the email address by adding double quotes around the local part: "!wawProdAIProjects"@domainsample.com While both versions seem to be legitimate according to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Email_address and a verification service like https://verifalia.com/validate-email, my contact's email management system considers the "modified" version with the double quotes as "undeliverable".

So now I am wondering if and how to stop Thunderbird from adding those double quotes? Any ideas?

Thank you!

Thomas
creator: ThomasMechau

title: Unable to Find Global Search
content:
I am trying to search through all of my messages.

The Global Search feature described here seems to be what I need: 

   https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/global-search

It says it will search all fields, accounts, folders, etc. for any messages.

It doesn't exist on my screen, though, the way it's described in that article (as a search box above the Filter box).

The closest feature I can find is Shift-Ctl-F that brings up a very narrowly targeted search facility that forces me to pick the specific folder that I want to search, and the field that I want to search within the eMails within that folder. This highly focused search is the exact opposite of the Global Search feature that I'm looking for, which doesn't make me specify anything to search through.

How do I invoke the Global Search feature, so that I can ask Thunderbird to "just find it" anywhere in the system when I type in a search term?
creator: bill355

title: Sudden error accessing Plusnet email from Thunderbird client
content:
For years I have been download/deleting emails from my Plusnet email address. This stopped working a few days ago. The attached images are (1) An AddException error message (2) A certificate from ViewCertificate

I am confused as to know what to do? The certificate has a validity entry that implies it should have stopped working August 19th ? but it worked until recently.

I will log another question on the Plusnet site, in case they could help, but anyone have any pointers?

I have not clicked on the 'Confirm Security Exception' button - although it looks like it wants me to - what are the issues/risks here ?

Thanks & regards Barry

PS Probably not relevant to the above, just FYI, but all my various email/gmail addresses are auto forwarded to plusnet. I then use Thunderbird to download and delete them, as they are filtered into a few dozen different subject folders.
creator: zarquonwhereareyou

title: Mensagens codificadas
content:
bom dia/boa tarde,

Estou com problemas para ler/abrir algumas mensagens de e-mail. Elas vem "codificadas" conforme o anexo.

Já no webmail, ou afins da mensagem no servidor ela está correta. Mas no Thunderbird ela aparece com problemas.

Já tentei algumas configurações mas sem sucesso. Alguém tem solução ou já passou por algo parecido, se sim o que fez para resolver?

Good morning/afternoon,

I'm having trouble reading/opening some email messages. They come "encoded" according to the attachment.

In webmail, on the server is correct. But in Thunderbird, it appears with problems.

I've tried some configurations but without success. Does anyone have a solution or has experienced something similar? If so, what did you do to solve it?
creator: thiago.a.w
